description: Nikola Petrak quietly reviews newly recovered BCI files, reading personal appeals from families searching for recognition and justice for their vanished loved ones.
Weighed by the stories, Nikola publicly announces his decision to authorize and launch the Memory Archive, urging citizens to reclaim lost histories and openly share erasures caused by the BCI.
Community volunteers begin the Memory Archive campaign, recording erased stories and searching for missing individuals; these efforts rapidly spread across neighborhoods.
Neighborhoods host mass events to share recovered stories and witness reunions, fostering collective healing and growing momentum for restorative justice.

The city's collective identity shifts to embrace open memory and citizen-led storytelling, signaling widespread rejection of previous automated governance and welcoming a new era of transparency and community leadership.
